newsitem.title: USA: Onyx Acceptance adopts rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Onyx Acceptance adopts rights plan.

text.p: Onyx Acceptance Corp Tuesday adopted a stockholders rights plan with a 15 percent ownership stake that triggers the plan.
Under the plan, one stock purchase right will be distributed as a dividend for each common share held by stockholders at the end of business on July 21.

Each right would entitle the holder to buy one one-thousandth of a share of a new series of preferred stock with an exercise price of $50.00 per share if a person or group acquired or attempted to acquire 15 percent or more of Onyx's common stock.
In a statement, Onyx noted the rights are designed to guard against partial tender offers and other tactics that might be used to gain control of the company without paying stockholders a fair price.
The rights will expire on July 20, 2007.
Onyx Acceptance is an Irvine-based company specializing in automobile finance with new and select used car dealerships.
